org.qcri.rheem.core.util

Class ConsumerIteratorAdapter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qcri.rheem.core.util.ConsumerIteratorAdapter<T>

  • public class ConsumerIteratorAdapter<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility to expose interfaces that accept a callback as an Iterator.

    This class uses a lock-free ring buffer to achieve a high throughput and minimize stall times. Note that the producer and consumer should run in different threads, otherwise deadlocks might occur.

    The producer obtains a Consumer via getConsumer() and pushes elements to it. When all elements are pushed, declareLastAdd() should be called. The consumer obtains a Iterator via getIterator() from that previously pushed elements can be obtained. Both operators can block when the buffer is full or empty.
